articles.title: Marines Pilot Artificial Intelligence Fellowship at NPS
articles.summary: U.S. Marines from across the service gathered at the Naval Postgraduate School August 11-14 to kick off the first artificial intelligence (AI) fellowship. The fellowship is an initiative of the 2024 USMC AI Strategy which aims to accelerate advanced AI research and build AI talent within the Marine Corps. The fellows will split their time between NPS and their home commands before concluding the pilot program in January 2026.

articles.title: ASU Expands Kay Bailey Hutchison Center into Institute
articles.author: Lucas Banda
articles.summary: Kay Bailey Hutchison Center for Cyber Intelligence, Innovation, and Security Studies at Angelo State University has been re-named the Kay Bailey Hutchinson Institute. Dr. Scarlet Clouse, dean of the ASU College of Education, has been named the institute's first permanent director. Clouse has formed an Innovation Focus Group that includes members representing many different areas of campus. The institute will provide four quadrants of support - innovation, operations, education and outreach.
